section_questions.question_text: Details on civil aviation accident reporting procedures can be found in the
question_reference: TC AIM-GEN – Reporting an Aviation Occurrence

section_questions.question_text: When an aircraft accident occurs, the pilot or operator of the aircraft involved shall ensure that the particulars of the accident are reported to the TSB
question_choice: as soon as possible and by the quickest means available.
question_reference: TC AIM-GEN – Information to Report

section_questions.question_text: The TSB shall be notified of a reportable aviation accident when
question_choice: a person sustains serious or fatal injury as a result of being in or coming into direct contact with any part of an aircraft.
an aircraft sustains damage or structural failure adversely affecting performance or flight characteristics and requiring major repair or replacement.
an aircraft is missing or completely inaccessible.
any of the above conditions exist.
question_reference: TC AIM-GEN – Accidents

section_questions.question_text: The TSB considers missing aircraft to be
question_choice: an occurrence which need not be reported.
an aviation incident which need not be reported.
question_reference: TC AIM-GEN – Accidents
